website_summaries.verdict: Focuses on healthy foods, and totally eliminates sugar, but does not require you to count calories or watch amounts of food eaten.
pros: The idea behind whole 30 is that you go on a very restrictive diet for 30 days and it resets your eating patterns, helps you lose weight, and makes you feel better
You eat whole foods only and skip processed foods
If you feel like you are addicted to junk food or sugar, this plan is designed to help you quickly break that addiction
cons: While the authors say it could be healthy, they also advise it is not very practical as a long-term food total solution

customer_reviews.title: did it for like a year
customer_reviews.text: i lost so much weight on this diet, did it for like a year. went from a size 14 to a size 4
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you buy "It Starts with Food" you don't need ...
customer_reviews.text: If you buy "It Starts with Food" you don't need this book too. So far the diet plan is working well.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Great starting point for anyone that wants to use for ...
customer_reviews.text: I swear by whole30. I bought the book, read it cover to cover, picked a date to start (2 weeks out), cleaned out the fridge and cupboards, meal planned, shopped, and meal prepped, then started. I am on day 15 of my 3rd consecutive round of Whole 30 and down 22 pounds and 21 inches all over. I cannot believe how this book has changed my life and the way I look at food! Great starting point for anyone that wants to use for nutrition rather than entertainment and who wants to be healthy and lose weight.
customer_reviews.author: Psychgirl70

customer_reviews.title: Pass this edition and get the Fast and Easy version!
customer_reviews.text: Half of this book is back story and information on the diet, not recipies. I recommend getting the Fast and Easy version that has sheet pan and crock pot Recipies for working families. Costs less, too!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolaus Noack

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer!
customer_reviews.text: This way of finding out what was causing inflammation has helped both me and my husband! We didn't start Whole 30 because of weight but because of other health issues. We plan on starting another Whole 30 next week to refine what we did with the first Whole 30!
customer_reviews.author: Celticmermaid

customer_reviews.title: I wish there was a 3.5 Star option...
customer_reviews.text: 1. The book is good quality, but most of the information in it can be found free on the internet. All you need to do is search whole 30 on Pinterest. 2. The author states that they intentionally and deliberately left out a week by week plan, but that’s exactly what I want; eating whole 30 takes A LOT of time to prepare. I would appreciate any and all help to reduce this time. I would like to have a week by week shopping list, prep plan, and meals laid out for me. I can always substitute and swap out based on my personal preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried my hardest to like and complete this program, I followed it strictly until day 14 and then I cracked with the constant fear that I would eat a spice or condiment that was not compliant, I was left starving all the time. I did not do it to loose weight, I have a healthy lifestyle but was hoping to reduce some stomach issues, they just ended up becoming worse.
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book! The diet is the healthiest way you ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book! The diet is the healthiest way you can possibly eat, the recipes are really amazing and easy to follow, and they outline what to expect to experience each of 30 days - which was nice.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Enjoyable read in addition to a color filled recipe book
customer_reviews.text: This book is an easy and enjoyable read. The authors did an excellent job combining humor and the information needed to complete the whole 30. The first half of the book is the cans/cannots and what to expects/whys of Whole 30. While the second half is a recipe book - these are delicious whether you're on the whole 30 or not! Highly recommend this book - color pictures of most recipes.
customer_reviews.author: ABon

customer_reviews.title: Just another book collecting dust on the shelf
customer_reviews.text: Tried this cookbook and failed miserably. Just seems like another fad.
customer_reviews.author: Little Miss Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Love Whole 30.  This wasn’t the book I needed- it doesn’t give enough background on how/why to do the whole 30.
customer_reviews.text: I got a couple tips but I wanted a different book to get me started. Whole 30 was GREAT! This book seems to have helpful recipes but I needed more of why to do Whole 30 and science behind it. I already have a houseful of cookbooks. This gave me the how to adequately - but I think the other book would have helped more.
customer_reviews.author: chicago mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Good diet, ok book
customer_reviews.text: The actual diet is really pretty great. I have a lot of energy, and much more even energy than when eating sugar and other prohibited items all the time. That being said, much of the book is pseudo science-y stuff, self help noise and motivational speaker silliness. There are too few recipes, and the book doesn't really help a whole lot with actually planning meal plans. Coming from doing 'shred' style meal planning. I was hoping for a little more practical advice about getting started with the diet. Basically it boils down to gluten free, no sugar, no legumes, no drinking.
customer_reviews.author: John Brosnan

customer_reviews.title: Not enough recipes
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a book to talk abut whole 30 and answer questions that could be googled, then continue with your purchase. I would seriously say 85% of this book is just info about whole 30. I wanted a book for recipes, not information. I didn’t immediately check the book when I got it so it’s too late to return, and the very few recipes that are in the book are good, so I’ll keep it. There’s 6 sections with 4-5 recipes each. With almost 300 pages, I should get WAY more than 24-30 recipes. I understand some info and back story is needed in a cookbook.....but not over 200 pages.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grateful for this program.
customer_reviews.text: It fits my body perfectly and I feel and look better than ever. I stay close to this for 6 months now. Lost more than weight. Clear head. Motivated. All body pain was gone. Inflammation is gone too. Sinus clear-no allergies. Digestion amazing. All of my studies in nutrition over the years agree with this eating plan.
customer_reviews.author: Janet StraightArrow

customer_reviews.title: Not useful as a cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: The information is useful but I find it extremely annoying as a cookbook. I cannot believe they did not provide a list, index, or table of contents for the recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life for the better. Not hard to do
customer_reviews.text: Changed my life. Not as difficult to do as one would think. I have seen lots of improvements since making the change to this lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: you will love it. You will feel so much better and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not really a diet; it's more of a lifestyle change. Once you get used to eating fresh fruits and vegetables and lean proteins, you will love it. You will feel so much better and sleep better, too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy17

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Book
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book and good advice for everyone. I love this book so much that I would love to buy everyone of my friends and family a copy because I think it's just that important, but unfortunately, not all of my friends and family are as interested as I am in getting healthy. If you are, I would definitely recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: TSQ

customer_reviews.title: Extreme diets are a recipe for diet cycles and eating disorders
customer_reviews.text: Want an eating disorder (or more of one)? Follow extreme diets like this or the Sugar detox book. Want to lose weight and have true food freedom? Buy 'intuitive eating' instead.
customer_reviews.author: Offie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for everyone, especially active people.
customer_reviews.text: I got this book because I like trying things my training clients try. Meh...I get it but I have a hard time buying into any “diet,” and it is a diet that athletes cannot participate in. It cracks me up because it goes against all college/professional/elite athletes do. They just need calories and carbs. One of my clients did try it and hated it. She said it got boring, real fast. The cravings never subsided and there’s so many eggs one can eat. She’s also pretty active though. For the average person, I can see this helping, especially for those who can’t control eating and cravings. I can also see it helping with pinpointing certain food allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne

customer_reviews.title: This book changed my life
customer_reviews.text: This book has literally changed my life. I struggle with an autoimmune disease called Hashimotos and was looking for ways to improve my symptoms. I started my first Whole30 in September of 2017 and within the month, many of my symptoms greatly improved and even disappeared. I felt so good that I have stayed on the Whole30 since that September. It has been a key part in my healing journey. I have ordered multiple of these books to give to family and friends who are struggling with their health. HIGHLY recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil & Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Your First Whole30 Manual, and future resource.
customer_reviews.text: Book #2 from this author for me, and it helped me with tips, recipes and a sample plan, through 30 Days of doing eating right... plus getting started on eating right for a lifetime. What's that worth? EVERYTHING!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie StPierre

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: was a little disapointed in this book. I should have known better than to buy it really. It's got a lot of common sense stuff in it which I didn't need reinforced in an expensive book, but kind of pushy on the delivery of the concept which was a turn off to me. Would have liked more recipes as well. I browsed through it and now it is collecting dust on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. Bought it a few months ago and refer back to it often for recipes and tips. Though the Whole 30 is very difficult to maintain for 30 days, I follow the idea to eat as clean as possible as much as possible. It's almost impossible to eat "out" and be 100% Whole 30. My favorite recipe is the Salmon Cakes and I've made them multiple times!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I like the book okay, just not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the book so I could start eating a whole food diet. Turns out, the book is about eliminating certain food groups from your diet entirely for 30 days and then adding them back in to see what your body has adverse reactions to, if anything. I suppose that would be good information to know, but not exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Good resource for changing diet and life
customer_reviews.text: Ok ... I only went on the Whole 30 because my doctor recommended it to solve some digestive issues. AND IT REALLY HELPED. I found the book informational but way too wordy. I don't need pages and pages of explanations. Just give me the facts and let me go. Recipes are good but I found myself modifying them (I'm also sensitive to garlic and onions and peppers and can't have them whether I'm doing Whole 30 or not). All in all, it's a good resource and I'm planning on sticking with a modified Whole 30 probably forever
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Table of Contents stops functioning
customer_reviews.text: This book had a working Table of Contents when I downloaded it. It then stopped working. What good is a Reference Book or Cook/Recipe Book without a functioning Table of Contents?
customer_reviews.author: good neighbor

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Recipes in this book are very hit and miss, especially one chicken disaster wherein the cook time was clearly incorrect. Overall, very bland, too basic and crazy expensive. Who can and who the heck wants to eat this much meat? I thought I was up for it, but this was just way past my limits. I'm glad a lot of people find this plan helpful for them, but it was a huge waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Approachable, life-changing.
customer_reviews.text: The ubiquitous Whole30 book lives up to the hype. The mix of "tough love" and also acceptance really changed the way I look at food. It's the first thing that finally took significant weight off me post-40s. I will live "Whole-30ish" probably forever...coming back to the full program whenever I need a reset. Everything you need to give it a go is in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: The Whole 30 is very well written, with facts ...
customer_reviews.text: The Whole 30 is very well written, with facts and humor. It gives you everything you need to be successful, and no timeline...you do that yourself. They make it very clear it's not a diet, it's a healthy detox to get off sugar and what you do after that is up to you. I purchased a book for my sister, told a friend of mine and she downloaded the book on her Kindle. Even if you don't do the Whole 30 it's an interesting book.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl hunt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am day five into my Whole 30 challenge, and I have used this book every day, and plan on using it for 25 more, and beyond. The recipes are simple enough, but require a bit more time. If you meal plan it's just fine. A lot of information on this health challenge is online, but this book is a wonderful reference guide.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: ... this one makes sense to me and is relatively easy to get
customer_reviews.text: I have ten of these type of books but this one makes sense to me and is relatively easy to get. Now making the changes for me will take a bit but the reasons and methods are clear.
customer_reviews.author: John DeLaney

customer_reviews.title: love this diet
customer_reviews.text: it is an extremely hard diet, you can't eat so many simple things, even going to a salad bar restricts you which was my hardest thing bc salad was my go to. but you feel amazing and learn what foods negatively affect your body. for me butter and beans became my own person ban due to this diet helping me realize I am happier and feel healthier without them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great book - especially if you have any health issues
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great book - especially if you have any health issues. Really sound advise according to dietitians I know. After 9 months I'm still following it and feel better than I have in years. Even if you don't try the whole 30 try cutting out the grains. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Whole30 Will Change Your Life!
customer_reviews.text: I love Whole30!!!! I lost 30 pounds during my 30 days in Whole30. I also went from being able to jog for 20 seconds before feeling like I was going to faint and having to walk to running a half marathon without walking. I have had stomach problems and been overly tired for the last 15 years. Whole30 has truly changed my life. I have tons of energy, I feel great and I will continue recommending Whole30 to everyone I meet!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Pacheco-Cancino

customer_reviews.title: Finally- this is the book and program that I needed
customer_reviews.text: I completed 1 round of Whole30 and could hardly believe the results. I have tried many things with no success and always am disappointed because none of it works for me. Well- this does. And it's no surprise, because you eat real food and can eat until you are satisfied. I took 2 days in between rounds and am starting round 2 now and will keep going for as long as I need to before I begin reintroducing foods. So thankful for this book and program! (if you want to really understand the science - explained in simple terms) also read, It Begins With Food by the same authors.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah's 2020 review

customer_reviews.title: Weight loss is secondary to learning what you are eating
customer_reviews.text: I like that the book explains the reasons behind why this “diet”works and has lots of recipes. In all honesty, most of the recipes I made were from Pinterest but I kept referring to the book for acceptable ingredients and to remind myself of all the benefits of doing Whole 30. It also has a section that expensive Laine how you are going to feel during all the ups and downs. I didn’t lose much weight, but I feel so much better since I have completed this challenge and feel much more informed about what I’m consuming and feeding my family. I would recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas B. Oman

customer_reviews.title: Experienced incrediable health benefits!
customer_reviews.text: This book, for me was a huge eye-opener! I realized how much sugar and preservatives affect my health. I've lost 13pounds just by changing my diet to whole foods. I feel completely satiated and have my slain my "Sugar Dragon". You are truely what you eat!
customer_reviews.author: David L Poulter

customer_reviews.title: Different book titles, same content
customer_reviews.text: All of Melissa’s books include the same core content. Don’t waste your money buying multiple books. Better yet, go to the Whole30 website and you can get the Whole30 guidelines for free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Embarrasing
customer_reviews.text: I could not read this book. The print was in grayscale. My husband had to read it tmo me.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie R.

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap! I tried it out for 30 days and ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap! I tried it out for 30 days and I lost a ton of weight and I also lost many inches. I decided to try it out because my clothes were not fitting me anymore but after all of the weight loss, my clothes still do not fit because they are now too big! The only exercise I performed during the 30 days were every day chores around the house (yard work, clean the pool, sweep and mop, etc...). I did feel a little disoriented at times during the first 7-10 days while my body was detoxing. The only other thing that was a bit concerning is the fact that I did not have a regular bowel movement.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar M. Meza

customer_reviews.title: It Works !
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes and a good read on how to get started on the Whole30 diet. Tasty and easy recipes. I ha e been on the diet for 30 days and lost 13 lbs and feel much more energetic. No more acidity problems that I was having after meals. Going to continue the diet for an additional 30 days. It taught me how to eat more healthy and I hope it will encourage me to continue this way of eating or at least make me aware in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Flora

customer_reviews.title: Boo
customer_reviews.text: Just another diet. Perpetuates disordered eating. So much love for you if you are still in the diet cycle ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Anna Major

customer_reviews.title: Good Healthy Food Plan
customer_reviews.text: I had been dieting, low carb, and lost 7 pounds in a month. I switched to this plan (when my book arrived) went on vacation and even still lost 4 more pounds. I’m still going thru it, learning the do’s and dont’s. I occasionally Google a question if I haven’t gotten to that part of the book yet. There is a lot of info on Google to help you thru it but I’d use the book as the main support. This is not a low carb or Paleo diet. It is more geared to NO SUGAR.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Rose

customer_reviews.title: New book but corners are damaged
customer_reviews.text: Had to deduct. Star due to the condition of the book when received. I had read reviews where corners of the books were damaged and mine was no exception. The front cover is also bowed and will not lay flat. Besides that, the book is unused and was a good price
customer_reviews.author: 40 YO Granny

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful for your Whole 30!
customer_reviews.text: This book was so helpful during my whole 30! If you can afford to buy only book for your whole 30 get this one, it has a lot of practical advise, if you can afford a second book, get "it starts with food", its a great book I've read a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is designed to help you break bad habits, for us
customer_reviews.text: This book makes sense. It explains why and how foods make you unhealthy and how to change that. It is a 30 day reset on the foods you eat. It is designed to help you break bad habits, for us, that would be sugar. There is a question and answer section that is helpful. A handy shopping list is included along with a meal template and 7 day meal plan. Recipes are included to help you get started. The book is well written in an easy to read format.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this book while prepping for Whole 30 experience. There are so many things that are useful to know about the philosophy, science behind and "what to expect" when doing the Whole 30. I go back to the book and re-read different sections often. It also contains a lot of specifics about food groups and a bunch of great recipes. Really informative and helpful - super glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Commitment Issues
customer_reviews.text: Love the get tough, no excuses start to this book. Then, it back tracked and cautions that a start date is needed and a kitchen clean out is needed. I lost the momentum because if you’re like me you’ve been at this diet stuff for a while. I’m still committed to the process but I did fall off the wagon because the tone changed. I guess I really need a good drill sergeant to kick start my journey.
customer_reviews.author: sourwood

customer_reviews.title: Must-have resource
customer_reviews.text: I got this book for the recipes. I’m not a big fruit and veggie eater. I’ve gotten into some bad habits and I needed a reset. These recipes are easy and not a lot of weird ingredients. This actually teaches you how to cook. There is a section on grilling, roasting and delicious sauces that don’t contain sugar, dairy. Even if your not totally sold on the program, I encourage everyone to get this book and gradually add a few recipes to your diet. It’s really worth the time and effort. You may be surprised at how you feel. Food freedom indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie West

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS BOOK!!!
customer_reviews.text: OBSESSED with this book! It’s truly encouraging me to be excited about starting it in a couple days. So many recipes and a true outline of what you can and can’t eat. Before I ordered this book I was researching online but every website said something different. A lot of recipes and sauces, as well as different food recipes for different occasions. there is even a thanksgiving section!!! Highly recommend this book for starters on whole 30.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Lundahl

customer_reviews.title: Great Program, But Better Recipes Elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I completed my first Whole30 over a month ago and I absolutely love the program! That being said, I found that I preferred recipes that I found myself to those in the book almost every time. I liked reading the informational part of the book, but wish that it was separate from the cookbook. I understand why it is not, but I feel I wasted my money when recipes that appeal to me more are so readily available online.
customer_reviews.author: kv

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results in a short time.
customer_reviews.text: It works if followed correctly. I have never felt better with a food plan. It is more of an elimination and recovery plan than a diet. Buy the book, join free Facebook groups for recipes, and that's your total commitment. No expensive food or buying meals from them. That's something I can get behind.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Tharp

customer_reviews.title: Buy the other Whole 30 cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This "cook book" is for beginners! example: how to boil an egg, how to roast a potato, BASIC COOKING SKILLS! If you are completely new to cooking you may like this book. If you already know the basics of cooking get the other Whole 30 book with actual recipes. This goes over the basics of Whole 30 but its nothing you can't look up on pinterest. :D
customer_reviews.author: Staci F.

customer_reviews.title: A great book focused on the Whole30 program without all the ...
customer_reviews.text: A great book focused on the Whole30 program without all the science-y stuff from It Starts With Food. If all you want to do is a Whole30 and not be bothered by WHY some foods are off the A-list for 30 days, definitely get this pretty book. It was a joy to have and to hold. Get hard copy for sure! If you want to know the science behind it, go ahead and get your copy of It Starts With Food. What are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Whole30 helped me lose 27 pounds in a month
customer_reviews.text: I’ve lost 27 pounds in one month so far on this “diet”. It’s incredible how it teaches you how to overcome food, which I didn’t even realize was controlling my life. You’ll love it as long as you actually stick to it! After the first 9 days, you’re golden! Stay strong because this plan works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will change your life for the better!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this book. Whole 30 is the most practical diet I've tried (and believe me, I've tried many) and this book breaks EVERYTHING down. It's a quick and easy read and left me feeling super confident to tackle the program for the first time. The recipes are also really great! They're easy, to the point, and delicious. I cannot wait to forever change my eating habits for the better. Do yourself a favor and get this book!!
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Great healthy eating plan
customer_reviews.text: Great healthy eating plan. I highly recommend purchasing this book if you plan on going on the Whole 30. They really go into detail about the program. It also offers multiple recipes, including salad dressing and marinades. Be careful just going off Pinterest recipes because some of them include ingredients that are not compliant to Whole 30.
customer_reviews.author: Lisandra de Gomez

customer_reviews.title: It includes great recipes, has some really great pieces of information ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is life changing! It includes great recipes, has some really great pieces of information regarding Whole30 logistics and what to expect, and just in general makes you think about how you view food and how it impacts your life. I've done one round of Whole30 and still continue to make these recipes - they're that good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes!
customer_reviews.text: My wife is reading this for the health information - I'm a man, I'm only interested in the recipes. Recipes are great, some need a minor tweak (Chicken meatballs - double the recipe, add 1 cup of almond flour, 1tsp chili powder. Some of the cooking temps need to be raised or cooking time longer.) If I had a personal chef, I'd have them prepare these meals all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Gun665

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book and every meal that I've created taste delicious
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book and every meal that I've created taste delicious!!! Very informative and it takes you step by step; the only drawback that I have is that the meals takes a long time to prepare during the week, I have little kids, homework etc... and it just becomes a chore for me to prepare. I guess if you follow the meal prep plan then things would go a bit faster but I have yet found time to prepare before hand.
customer_reviews.author: sherry bumpers

customer_reviews.title: Read the Book and Start A New Life
customer_reviews.text: The book was very helpful to get started on a new was of eating. I am almost done with 3 weeks on the program and feel very good about eating healthier but at the same time eating food I really like. I would recommend this program to anyone who wants to lose weight but not limited to certain food. I eat chicken, fish, all types of meat. The biggest change is no dairy and no sugar. My wife has been on the Whole 30 for the same amount of time and feels better and is never hungry. This program is for 30 days but the goal is to continue eating this way for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Newman

customer_reviews.title: Be committed for 30 days, concentrate on what you can eat and not what you can't.
customer_reviews.text: Been on this program for 2 months. Lost 25 lbs. even though I have done no exercises. due to knee replacement surgery.
customer_reviews.author: janice powers

customer_reviews.title: Eat Clean and Improve Your Health
customer_reviews.text: I was astounded at the results from eating clean for only 30 days. I realized that even though foods may be considered healthy, they are not healthy for me. Whole30 opened my eyes to the importance of clean eating. Losing weight is the bonus to using the Whole30 plan, but the most benefit is the positive test results.
customer_reviews.author: pm

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Easy and a great way too find out what your body should and should not be eating! You give up 5 inflammatory food groups for 30 days. Legumes, Dairy, Alcohol, Sweeteners of any kind and of course Gluten. The best effect? I dropped almost 20 lbs that month! Since then we've stuck close to it and no weight has cone back over a year later. My husband no longer has bloat issues and both our joint stiffness is gone! I tell everyone about this plan!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Giacomozzi

customer_reviews.title: Get To The Point
customer_reviews.text: I just read this book on my kindle. There is good information in the first few chapters but then it repeats the same info with Questions & Answer. I also thought a meal plan would be in this book for the 30 days. The 7 day is poorly formatted on the kindle page. The book needed to get to the point and provide plans for it to be worth the kindle price.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Olive Jr

customer_reviews.title: If you are thinking of trying the Whole30 - get this book
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting to try the Whole30 but was nervous. I bought this book 2 days before I started and it was a lifesaver. There is a page where they provide a 7 day plan to get you started which was awesome. I made it through the 30 days with great success and will keep going ... though on a modified basis. If you are thinking of trying the Whole30 I strongly suggest getting this book to assist.
customer_reviews.author: Hnicks

customer_reviews.title: Great book!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book!! It has real, practical health food ideas and tips. The recipes are actually GOOD and easy! While I can't bring myself to go completely whole 30 (because I refuse to live without my chemically-laden coffee creamer) this book has inspired to read labels, grocery shop healthier, and eat better. I will be purchasing her next book ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: A must-read for whole30 tips and recipes to change your life!
customer_reviews.text: The Whole30 is life-changing and will change the way you look at food and how your body reacts. It helped for me to overcome severe sensitivities to food and gain a good balance back along with figuring out what my triggers were to making me feel sick. In addition you'll also find yourself gaining more energy, mental and emotional balance, as well as a change in the way you look and feel. This book is so wonderful for those going through it or wanting to try it out as it gives great advice and easy recipes! Great as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Clean out your pantry of all unhealthy foods/products
customer_reviews.text: Clean out your kitchen pantry of every product you've been eating...shop their list ONLY...eat what, how, when & why the book tells you to and you'll feel like a new person. I'm sure, very healthy. OR cut down in portions, stop eating sweets and a lot of bad carbs.
customer_reviews.author: Glad/Jim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book with delicious healthy recipes that have great weight ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived sooo fast!!! Amazing book with delicious healthy recipes that have great weight loss results. A great effective diet and nutrition program. I was able to lose 13 pounds between Thanksgiving and New Years which is nothing short of miraculous. I have been trying to lose weight for years but just haven't been able too. Nothing worked before.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Lakamsani

customer_reviews.title: not a good purchase for me
customer_reviews.text: Can't say I found any information in this book that i couldn't find online. Unfortunately, not a good purchase for me. Also wasn't a fan of the "lifestyle/diet". Felt and saw no change. :(
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple book to read; well written
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great book. It teaches you the simplicity for the program and how to cook for yourself even if you are a novice. I adapted a few of the sauce recipes to make them a bit more friendly for my family. I really enjoy HOW the book is written to normal people; it isn't written over your head. I won't lie... this is a hard program but just being in it for less than 2-weeks; I've lost 7pounds, my nephew has lost 17 and we feel better. The sugar dragon is still alive here but it's slowly dying...
customer_reviews.author: S. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource to Change your Eating Habits!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book about 40 days ago. I read the book for about a week and a half and then my wife and I jumped right in to the Whole30 eating plan. Information from this book was invaluable and it along with on line groups guided us to a successful eating change. In 30 days we both felt better, had more energy, slept more soundly and....we lost a combined 22 pounds in 30 days! 11.4 for me and 8.5 for my wife. Highly recommended for those who want to take control of your eating habits.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Swize

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this book to patients with inflammatory problems
customer_reviews.text: As a healthcare practitioner, I recommend this book to patients with inflammatory problems. This is the easiest and funniest way to eat a clean and low inflammation diet. The recipes and options make the dieting fun!
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book provides a great overview of the Whole30 including meal plans. It has a great variety of recipes for those following a whole30/paleo lifestyle. From condiments and veggies to meat and seafood, this book will not disappoint. The homemade ketchup and mayo recipes are the best I've found yet. Highly recommend this book to those wanting to pursue a Whole30 lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: WHOLE30
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is well written and is a great read. Melissa has a talent for making eating fun. She explains the science behind why "Whole30" works and provides encouraging words to help you stick to the plan of clean eating. I love the sections that include grocery list and kitchen must haves. This is key for an at home cook who needs a plan of attack for weight loss or just healthy eating. Love this cookbook!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: leslye

customer_reviews.title: Good guide
customer_reviews.text: This book was a great introductory guide to the whole 30 system. It was very explanatory and easy to follow. I can’t say that I used a lot of the recipes in the book. I was able to take the basic premise and adapt my own recipes which I really appreciated. I lent the book to a friend and never got it back so I guess that says something good too!
customer_reviews.author: S. Peters

customer_reviews.title: I don’t really like this recipe book because it requires you to flip ...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really like this recipe book because it requires you to flip back and forth through pages for one nights meal. I’d prefer it much more if everything that is suggested for one meal was on one page and was more straight forward. I did like all the recipes I made though, but I prefer the “fast and easy” book much more
customer_reviews.author: bryce egelin

customer_reviews.title: All this info is available online
customer_reviews.text: Probably didn't need to buy this - everything you need to know is on the web. The one thing I like about this book is the "basic recipe" section. How to make eggs 5 ways, basic burger recipe, basic salmon recipe, etc. I found those the most helpful and I've been cooking for 20 years. Its just an easy quick reference that I use as a guide for cooking temps and basic spices.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Stanek

customer_reviews.title: I would say 95% of the recipes are easy weeknight meals
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book as soon as it was released and even though I already read ISWF this book is worth it for the recipes alone. Since I received this book late this summer not a week has gone by that I haven't made at least one recipe from here. I would say 95% of the recipes are easy weeknight meals (read: doesn't take forever to get dinner on the table after work) and are my go to meals for a busy week. Some of our family favorites are: Walnut Crusted Pork Tenderloin Butternut Squash Soup Pork Chops on a Bed of Greens
customer_reviews.author: A Mill

customer_reviews.title: I returned this book since it didn't really have much ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this book since it didn't really have much going for it in terms of recipes. It explains the diet, I guess, but I wanted a recipe book.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very informative. I have learned a lot and have started eating healthier too. Recipes are easy to follow and even if you don’t know what you’re doing in the kitchen, you’d still be able to make a really good meal.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Ram

customer_reviews.title: Neat book, but I complicated
customer_reviews.text: I find this book a bit complicated for me, I also have celiacs disease so trying to do things gluten free as well is always trying. I have had to buy a few things like a veggie spiral device and some others for recipes. It's just hard.
customer_reviews.author: JakeTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Best program I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Best program I've tried. the recipes are to die for. It's a lot of time in the kitchen but after a couple weeks I got the hang of and now I love to cook!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BOOK BEGORE YOU TRY THE WHOLE 30 Plan
customer_reviews.text: It’s NOT A diet, it’s a 30 day elimination plan during which you focus on doing without certain foods which might cause issues with your body’s. You will eat real food, cook ALOT, wash dishes a lot, and love every bite of food you eat. You will focus on those cravings and energy levels during the day. You will learn about your relationship with food and certain types of food. You’ll love it and learn so many good cooking tips! A home-economics book for a new generation! Don’t try the plan without the book! The book is worth much more! Recipes are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Keto recipes and explanations
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great tool for keto dieters. It explains the science very well and has a lot of recipes to get you started. However, it offers next to nothing for vegetarians except to tell them they should eat meat. It explores the dangers of dairy and soy, but treats meat as if it is all good, but that is if you can afford free range meat. I don't think it did justice to the dangers of meat the way it did, for instance, to dairy. As a lifelong vegetarian, i decided the keto diet was not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life! <3
customer_reviews.text: Really will change your life. Thanks to Whole30, I am sugar free, easily and happily eat whole foods, am MUCH healthier, and love cooking now. Until I learned how to do it, I Googled "Whole30 approved" ingredients and recipes as I went. Free to join online. Best 30 days EVER! It's been almost 2 years and I'll never go back to processed foods. Can't recommend Whole30 enough to jump start anyone into eating right.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the Kindle version!
customer_reviews.text: So I just started reading and the book may be good but the app is horrible! Kindle version can't keep up with flipping pages and I have to leave the app and restart because it freezes. Also flipping the page goes to the last word on the screen so you then have to drag the words back on the screen to read each page. It's very distracting and aggravating. I've read really long books on Kindle so the length is not the problem. They need to fix it though. It's hard to read.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: A Welcome Life-Changing Book
customer_reviews.text: Even a newbie to these types of programs like me can appreciate the user-friendly approach to health. Just flipping through the cookbook makes my heart and body feel better, I can't wait to try some of the meals. I appreciate the "make your own meal plan" approach and think that for me being told I have a range of options instead of a mandatory list makes me more likely to succeed. I will say that reading the It Starts with Food book is a good idea just for the huge amount of background knowledge given. Educating yourself before taking on a life-change such as this is key.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Horne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have loved everything we have made out of here, The Chicken Chowder is especially tasty!
customer_reviews.author: Dewann

customer_reviews.title: ... am thoroughly enjoying this diet and the book has wonderful recipes. I've been on it 6 weeks now ...
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly enjoying this diet and the book has wonderful recipes. I've been on it 6 weeks now and am losing weight and feeling better. The organization of the book took a little bit to get used to as I use it as a reference. Overall, I highly recommend it! My husband and I took a month before our goal start date to cut back on the things we knew we'd be giving up which I believe helped immensely!
customer_reviews.author: katniss everdeen

customer_reviews.title: A Very Healthy Diet you can Sustain for 30 days
customer_reviews.text: A great support for this diet plan-- and a great diet. I wanted to reduce inflammation which this is great for--which helps several ailments, but the unexpected benefit is that you change the importance of eating due to stress, and foods taste much better. After just a week, you notice a lot of changes. It's not that difficult but the book just enforces what you are doing. I lost more inches than pounds, but the pounds were substantial. Give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: Knit one

customer_reviews.title: Your basic low carb nothing more
customer_reviews.text: What are the whole foods thirty? ?The book never lists them..however you MUST avoid these:Alcohol. ..breads...sugar. ...peanuts..legumes... dairy. ...it focuses on your basic veggies plus protein. ...nothing new here.
customer_reviews.author: deborah duck

customer_reviews.title: I love the added details to the book and the daily ...
customer_reviews.text: Whole30 is a game-changer! I love the added details to the book and the daily expectations from the diet. Within a week I already felt a difference. I love that it emphasizes how you feel and not a number on a scale. This will continue to be a guide for healthy eating, even outside of the 30 days. I highly recommend trying Whole30.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam D

customer_reviews.title: A great plan and book
customer_reviews.text: Love The Whole30. I was having a lot of inflammation issues, so decided to give it a try. I felt so much better. Pain gone. Migraines gone. 15 pounds gone. 13 inches gone. The book does a great job of explaining what to and not to eat and why. Cheat sheets for acceptable ingredients and forbidden ingredients are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Zebramom

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a diet, its a lifestyle change.
customer_reviews.text: I love the whole30. I lost weight and inches. I gained energy and a lottle more confidence because i had to buy new smaller clothes. I noticed my allergies were gone. I live in cincinnati and the air quality is horrible. I was surprised. The system really works if you commit and not cheat. It's only 30 days, what do you have to lose?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for us!
customer_reviews.text: We just completed the Whole 30 and it worked for us. Feeling better, less arthritis pain (inflammation), and weight loss. We feel so much better we are committed to making many of the changes permanent.
customer_reviews.author: atldallas

customer_reviews.title: Just as amazing as everybody says!
customer_reviews.text: I did Whole30 in January 2018 and it completely changed the way I look at food and cooking. I feel much more organized in the kitchen now and I’ve truly been able to expand my cooking knowledge and really test my limits. I lost 10 pounds in the 30 days and did not cheat once! At the end of it all, I was honestly so proud for finishing that I really didn’t care how much weight I lost (although 10 pounds is perfectly fine with me!) I felt recharged at the end and I highly reccomend this!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Dias

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!  Highly Recommend It.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book where you can learn about Whole30 and it has great recipes. It is the first book I purchased about the Whole30 and is very informative. It gave me detailed insight into the program. If you are thinking about starting this program or are "into" this program, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly's Corner

product_meta.title: The Whole30: The 30-Day Guide to Total Health and Food Freedom
